section.title: How to connect with external cloud storages
section.para: Cloud storage eformsign can automatically save completed documents in an external cloud storage service. Currently, Dropbox, Google Drive, OneDrive, and box are supported.

note.para: Only Company administrator can connect eformsign with the external cloud storages.

section.para: 1. Go to the Integration > Cloud storage menu.
2. Select the cloud storage where you want to save the completed documents, and then click the Connect button to log in.
3. After logging in, the Disconnect button and the Storage path settings button will be displayed. If you need to save the storage path, click the Storage path settings button.

figure.title: Connecting and disconnecting accounts with the file storages

note.para: The Storage path settings pop-up window is displayed as follows:

The default path is the subfolder named with your company name, which is located under the eformsign folder. You can also click the New folder button to create a new folder and change the storage path.

section.para: 4. Go to the Manage templates menu.
5. Click the template you want to save the documents (created by the template) to the cloud storages, and then go to the Template settings screen.

figure.title: Setting the Complete step of the Workflow

section.para: 7. In the Properties tab of the Complete step, tick the Backup completed documents in external cloud storages checkbox. You can check whether the cloud storages set in the Cloud storage menu are connected. When a document is completed, it will be automatically saved in the connected cloud storage as well as on eformsign.

figure.title: The Backup completed documents in external cloud storages checkbox

section.title: Analytics and reporting
section.para: Analytics and reporting If you find it cumbersome and repetitive to download a CSV file every time a new document is added, using this feature is recommended. You can set the entered data to be automatically saved in the sheet of Google Sheets and the Excel sheet of Microsoft Office 365.

note.para: Analytics and reporting can be set only by the Company administrator.

section.para: 1. Go to the Integration > Analytics and reporting menu.
2. Select a service from Google Sheets and Microsoft Office 365, and then click the Connect account button to log in.
3. Click the Manage data connections button.
4. Click the Add data connection button in the center of the screen or at the top right of the screen.
5. Set the items such as Connection name, Data connection sheet, When to send data, and Templates, and then click the Save button.

note.para: The data connected sheet corresponds to the URL of the sheet in Google Sheets.

section.para: 6. The data connected sheet is displayed on the Manage data connections screen.
7. If you go to the connected sheet, you can see the columns displayed to which field data will be automatically imported from eformsign.
